Text.text: The following sections describe how you replace texts in your generated apps where building blocks are used. When you have created your specific application component, standard texts are available from a building block and these standard texts can be overridden by application-specific texts.

Panel.headerText: 1.) Adapt the manifest to override the texts

Text.text: Changes must be made in the manifest file of the application. Add 'enhanceI18n' to the settings of the corresponding section as shown in the following code sample:

Panel.headerText: 2.) Create an i18n properties file to override the text

Text.text: When you have created your specific application component, for example in SAP Fiori tools, standard texts are available from a specific template component (for example, i18n file within the application folder)
1. If i18n file is not present then create a file in the application
2. Add the relevant key and the text to be overridden to the newly created or existing file

Panel.headerText: 3.) You can now use the building blocks provided by SAP Fiori elements

Text.text: Example: Using the 'Filter Bar' building block. Add the editing status key to the i18n properties file.
